title: Senior Data Scientist, Forta
summary: Remote, -, - About this role The Forta Foundation is looking for a senior data scientist to help innovate to bring data science solutions to the Forta ecosystem. You will analyze blockchain attack data and prototype data science solutions to glean insights
content:
Remote, -, -

About this role

The Forta Foundation is looking for a senior data scientist to help innovate to bring data science solutions to the Forta ecosystem. You will analyze blockchain attack data and prototype data science solutions to glean insights into the attacks, predict attacks and scams, and aid with the consumption of alerts.

In this role, you will work and empower the broader data science and academic research community to bring innovative solutions to the Forta ecosystem through prototyping, educational content, research papers & blog posts, data curation, and data science competitions.

The ideal candidate is passionate about how data science can help derive insights that can protect web3 ecosystem and is thrilled to work with a global data science and research community.

Resources:

Data Science and Machine Learning on Forta. docs.forta.network/en/latest/ds-and-ml/ Kaggle Competition: It's Time to Protect Web3 with Forta. www.kaggle.com/competitions/forta-prote‚Ä¶ Forta Labeled Datasets. github.com/forta-network/labelled-datas‚Ä¶

What you‚Äôll be doing

  • Analyze blockchain and attack data
  • Prototype a broad range of models: from supervised to unsupervised models to detect attacks, rank alerts, provide context to alert data
  • Empower the data science community to protect web3 (e.g. through data set curation, prototyping, contest preparation)
  • Work with data science and engineering community to evolve the Forta Network‚Äôs data science and machine learning capabilities
  • Facilitate a research agenda with the data science and academic research community (e.g. through RFPs and regular community calls)
  • Educate the broader community on data science approaches to web3 through statistics and data science (e.g. through research papers & blog posts, conference talks, social media presentations)

Ideally, you have:

  • 5+ years of professional experience in Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing, Deep Learning, Anomaly Detection, Clustering, Time Series Analysis, and related areas.
  • Expertise with Python and experience with other scripting languages (e.g., R, or similar).
  • Experience with libraries such as Pandas, Keras, Pytorch, Scikit-learn etc. to build ML models.
  • Attention to detail with self-discipline and a drive for results.
  • Demonstrated ability to work in ambiguous situations and with geographically distributed teams.
  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, or related technical field or equivalent experience.
  • Excellent writing and communication skills.
  • Ability to convey complex technical topics into easy to understand materials.
  • Strong personal organizational skills and a love for self-time management.
  • A startup mentality with a bias to action and the ability to be flexible in a fast-paced environment.
  • Passion and/or experience with open-source or cybersecurity or similar highly technical industry is preferred.
  • Technical knowledge of blockchain, DeFi and the Ethereum ecosystem is preferred.

summary: Chicago, Illinois, United States of America About the job Will work on the intersection of development, research, and operations, discovering new requirements through working with scientific users, designing and building solutions that change the way
content:
Chicago, Illinois, United States of America

About the job

  • Will work on the intersection of development, research, and operations, discovering new requirements through working with scientific users, designing and building solutions that change the way science is done, deploying and operating them, and then supporting and interacting with their users to build communities around them.

Resonsibilities

  • Helps build and operate the Chameleon experimental platform (‚Äãwww.chameleoncloud.org‚Äã): specific tasks may range from integrating state-of-the-art technologies such as disaggregated hardware or IoT devices, evaluating and extending open source systems and tools such as OpenStack, and new feature development -- to system upgrades and maintenance, or implementing security controls.

Familiarity with front-end technologies, portal development, and Jupyter.

title: Back-End / Data Engineer, Publisher Discovery
summary: Remote (within UK only), Remote, United Kingdom Publisher Discovery is hiring a remote Back-End & Data Engineer to help build, run and evolve the pipelines and platform that underpin our business insights technology. We make it easier for online
content:
Remote (within UK only), Remote, United Kingdom

Publisher Discovery is hiring a remote Back-End & Data Engineer to help build, run and evolve the pipelines and platform that underpin our business insights technology.

We make it easier for online advertisers to identify where best to associate ads across affiliate networks. We collate data from a wide variety of resources and APIs. We then process and transform this data to power ML models and present it to our customers, either through our UI or directly transferred to them. This cost-saving and advertising effectiveness solution is especially relevant during a toughening economic climate.

We offer a role that's diverse in the nature and scope of challenge, and we can find initiatives that suit your current skills and ambitions, and help you grow.

You'll work closely with our CTO and engineers, getting involved with everything from our APIs, automation, methods and tooling, and the production environment. The role will be approximately equal parts green field development and enhancing our existing codebase and infrastructure - working mainly with Python and Node.js. We have a compact dev team and run a lightweight Kanban process, we release early and often.

We offer a collaborative and friendly culture, with a flat structure. We can offer technical mentoring, pairing and guidance while you progress into delivering on more challenging objectives. You'll also have lots of autonomy, with plenty of time for research, to try things out and to complete projects. You'll find us open minded and supportive of your development and ideas.

A flavour of the work and projects:

  • Migrating manual pipelines to become fully automated, towards CI/CD
  • Updating the data scraping methods that collect data - it's an arms race!
  • Configuring and adding new affiliate networks to our system, with Python
  • Modernising deployment infrastructure, e.g. with AirFlow/KubeFlow
  • Evolving pipeline orchestration methods
  • Maintaining the pipelines that manifest ML
  • Modifying and extending APIs and - optionally - creating new product back-end capabilities with Python
  • Supporting medium term project to adopt and build out MLOps
  • Production ops - observability, security, maintenance etc.

¬£60,000 - ¬£70,000 - reviewed at six months - we're keeping an open mind 25 days holiday, plus public holidays Share options scheme Fully remote | flexible hours | work from home or shared office Choice of laptop platform and support on your home office equipment

title: Senior and Semi Senior Developers - Argentina Only, Wuru
summary: Buenos Aires, Rosario, Cordoba, Buenos Aires, Santa Fe, Cordoba, Argentina We are looking for Software Engineers who have a passion for technology and solving interesting challenges. You will design and implement highly scalable systems and algorithms for
content:
Buenos Aires, Rosario, Cordoba, Buenos Aires, Santa Fe, Cordoba, Argentina

We are looking for Software Engineers who have a passion for technology and solving interesting challenges. You will design and implement highly scalable systems and algorithms for high throughput, performance, reliability and latency. You will join a startup tech team that is building data products that enable more and better healthcare.

The output of your work will be instrumental in redefining healthcare operations. Apply modern technologies ‚Äî micro services, data apps, data pipelines, machine learning ‚Äî to healthcare operations. Come help us deliver great products to healthcare teams

Objectives of this Role

  • Architect, design, implement, test and deliver highly scalable products.

  • Master our development process, culture, and codebase, then improve it.

  • Operate effectively in the hybrid engineering model where engineers are encouraged to de

    sign and execute the vital work to ensure quality in their own code as well as other engineers.

  • Mentor others in development technologies, tools and processes.

  • Develop test strategies, design automation frameworks and write unit/functional tests to

    drive up code coverage and automation metrics.

Responsibilities

  • Design and implement highly scalable systems and algorithms for high throughput and performance
  • Architect data pipelines and web applications for company products
  • Create microservices and data apps using Python, JavaScript and cloud architecture (AWS)
  • Learn new company technologies and work effectively in a fast-paced dynamic environment.
  • Work closely with the rest of the team members to develop, test, deploy, and operate high quality software.
  • Bring positive energy!

Qualifications Requirements

  • Deep knowledge and industry proven experience in Python.

  • REST APIs and general API design.

  • Experience with Agile software development and test-driven development.

  • Good algorithmic thinking

  • Ability to deliver and passion for high quality code

  • Experience in system architecture design and development

  • Hands on experience in AWS. (cloudformation, VPC, ECS fargate, EC2, Lambda)

  • Ability to start projects from scratch (Git, CI/CD pipeline, docker)

  • Experience and development/operation background of containerization technologies (such as

    Kubernetes).

  • Experience with Docker and microservices.

  • Knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases (PostgreSQL or MySQL, DynamoDB, MongoDB)

  • Experience with orchestration tools such as Apache Airflow.

  • Experience building ETL/ELT data pipelines.

Nice to have

  • Experience in front end development.

  • JavaScript, React, Next.JS.

  • Experience building and deploying data pipelines to cloud platforms such as AWS, GCP, Azure

    etc.

  • Experience of leading projects and/or agile engineering teams.

title: Director of Engineering, Plantbid
summary: Madisonville, LA, United States We are looking for an experienced, driven, and flexible Director of Engineering to join our proven and growing startup team. This role will work together with every member of our small, close-knit team to build out our
content:
Madisonville, LA, United States

We are looking for an experienced, driven, and flexible Director of Engineering to join our proven and growing startup team.

This role will work together with every member of our small, close-knit team to build out our Product Engineering team and to build the next major evolution of our platform. This is a hybrid role that will combine some strategic thinking and leadership with some hands-on development work. You will manage the department's budget and have a lot of freedom to deploy that budget however you think will get the best results. We have a profit-sharing plan which means the more we grow, the more your bonus grows.

Role Responsibilities

  • Lead a small team of really good Engineers.
  • Think about the big picture. Go beyond "just code" to understand and influence the whole business.
  • Write great Python code.
  • Apply critical thinking and creative problem solving to turn high-level feature descriptions, designs, and business needs into robust software.
  • Be organized and self-starting so that we don't have to pester you about the state of your work.
  • Experience leading a Software Engineering team.
  • Experience designing system architecture for web applications.
  • Experience with a server-side MVC framework (preferably Django, but others are good too).
  • Experience implementing complex business logic in a programming language (preferably Python and JavaScript, but others are good too).
  • We put more weight on your past projects and accomplishments than on years of experience.

Nice to Have

  • Experience developing e-commerce, CRM, ERP, accounting-- or similar-- software.
  • Experience with frontend frameworks like React or Vue.
  • Any other technical skills.

title: Data Scientist (f/m/d) - Data Analytics, United Internet
summary: Karlsruhe, Germany IONOS is a fast growing, customer centered provider of domain, hosting, web, e-commerce, server and cloud solutions. We operate in numerous European countries and the USA. We are a young company with high tech competence that offers its
content:
Karlsruhe, Germany

IONOS is a fast growing, customer centered provider of domain, hosting, web, e-commerce, server and cloud solutions. We operate in numerous European countries and the USA. We are a young company with high tech competence that offers its employees a future-proof workplace with exciting projects, a steep learning curve, individual training opportunities and good career prospects. To strengthen our Advanced Analytics team in the area of Customer Intelligence, we are looking for a Data Scientist with a focus on Data Analytics for the following tasks:

  • In cooperation with the relevant departments, you will develop metrics for measuring & controlling Customer Success Management.
  • You will develop and visualize data models on customer behavior and product usage in order to create a comprehensible and complete basis for information and decision-making for our internal customers.
  • You support the departments in building target group specific campaigns with your data know-how.
  • You support the Data Engineers in the area in tapping, integrating and extending data sources in our DWH.
  • You will participate in the further development of attribution models for operational and analytical use.

For the position available, you will meet the following requirements:

  • You quickly orient yourself in new complex situations. In doing so, you are convincing in a quick grasp of the objectives and work towards their solution in a goal-oriented manner.
  • You have good knowledge and practical experience in SQL. Knowledge of at least one programming or scripting language, preferably Python, is also desirable.
  • You are experienced in using Google Workspace tools as well as data visualization programs such as Looker.
  • Very high analytical skills, as well as a structured and method-based way of working, which enables them to translate business-specific issues into a numbers and data-based model.
  • You communicate proactively and confidently at all levels, depending on what the current situation requires.
  • You possess a high level of initiative and the ability to learn new things independently.

content:
London, United Kingdom

As a Software Engineer, you will help us build and develop the SaaS platform. We are looking for someone with software development best practice experience. Proven experience in delivering end-to-end practical solutions is a must. We are seeking a software engineer who can work in a close-knit team within a distributed environment.

You will work full time in a hybrid location arrangement. Being in the office on a Tuesday and Thursday and working from home for the rest of the time. Opportunities for professional development are available, and continuing professional development is both encouraged and expected.

  • Designing and delivering apps and dashboards.

  • Knows the appropriate time to ask questions and produces well-structured weekly reports and project documentation
  • Degree in a STEM or similarly quantitative field.
  • 4+ years of working experience as a software developer.
  • Hands-on programming experience in Python (Flask), database management (mongo, postgres), NodeJS/React, microservices, automated deployment.
  • Experience in taking ideas from conception through to deployment and implementation.
  • Used to working with cloud technologies.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Practical experience in online web-tracking technologies and infrastructure.
  • Proven delivery of web applications, complete with front-end interface and scalable architecture.
  • Agile / Scrum experience: development sprints, supporting sales and pitches and delivering on technical development.
  • Excitement to work in a rapidly changing and ambitious start-up, where flexibility and constructive challenge are key.
  • Capacity to learn new systems and techniques quickly.
  • Experience in AI/ML with Spiking Neural Networks preferred.
  • Ability to be productive in a distributed team through self discipline and self motivation, delivering according to a schedule.
  • Strong English communication skills, especially over phone, email and Slack.

content:
Remote, USA

We are searching for a Software Developer to join a team that is making genomic information actionable.

The ideal candidate has had a range of experience working with both back-end and front-end technologies, especially for web-based applications and back-end data processing applications and pipelines handling large amounts of textual, genomic, or similar data.

Our client provides the opportunity to work on a small but effective development team that values empathy, support, and productivity. You'll be contributing directly to a product that save lives by helping clinicians diagnose and treat patients suffering from rare diseases and cancer--and helps precision medicine companies create targeted therapies for diseases.

COMPENSATION

$90K to $110K

Our client offers an excellent benefit package.

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science strongly preferred

  • Willing to work in any sector of the full stack as needed, and to take ownership of the software that you build

ANY OF THE FOLLOWING WOULD BE GREAT

  • Experience with Elasticsearch or other text indexing and search software
  • Experience with bioinformatics
  • Experience with genomics or pharmacogenomics
  • Experience with big data

Ruby | Rails | Go | Elasticsearch | Python | bioinformatics | genomics | big data | 3838-PY

Please submit resume and cover letter with the job title/number in the email. We have a bunch of technology jobs available! Visit our website at www.stoutsystems.com/jobs. We host free career webinars every week! Visit our calendar at www.stoutsystems.com/events.

title: Python Software Engineer, CV Screen Ltd
summary: Cheltenham, United Kingdom CV Screen is recruiting for an experienced Software Engineer with strong Python skills to join a leading technology company operating in the defence and national security market. Remote working is available with travel to the
content:
Cheltenham, United Kingdom

CV Screen is recruiting for an experienced Software Engineer with strong Python skills to join a leading technology company operating in the defence and national security market. Remote working is available with travel to the offices required on an ad hoc basis ‚Äì a salary of up to ¬£65,000 is available.

Remote working is available.

COMPANY DETAILS

You will join an organisation who work with cutting edge technology and research. You will join a company of over 50 who are all working to make a difference.

THE ROLE IN A NUTSHELL

You will use the latest technologies including Python and Angular to develop Internet facing systems, complex data and analytics, and machine intelligence. You‚Äôll carry out high risk research, turning academic and company research into engineering, build concept demonstrators, develop prototypes, and deliver managed services. Your work, therefore, spans the whole spectrum of software development.

SALARY:

¬£65,000 Plus fantastic benefits which include:

  • Flexible working hours, additional paid or unpaid leave and sabbaticals which is all designed to give you the quality of life that you desire.
  • A competitive salary depending on experience
  • Generous pension provision: Company contribution is 10% of basic pay
  • Performance and business development bonuses
  • 25 days holiday per year plus Public Holidays

LOCATION:

Largely Remote or hybrid Work with the requirement to travel to offices in Gloucestershire when required.

Would suit candidates based in: Bristol | Gloucester | Cheltenham | Swindon | Tewkesbury

TO APPLY

Please send your CV and details through to Sam Gillett of CV Screen in strict confidence.

ALTERNATE TITLES

Senior Software Engineer | Software Developer | Python Developer

REQUIREMENTS

  • Candidates will have a good degree in computer science (Master or PhD desirable)
  • A knowledge of a wide range of software languages and methodologies, including Python, JavaScript and Angular.
  • Experience with a major Defence company would be an advantage.
  • Please be aware that because of the nature of work, staff require a Government security clearance, and a successful candidate must be a British citizen and meet the criteria for clearance.

title: Software Engineer - Integrations, Splunk
summary: Krak√≥w, Krak√≥w, Poland Are you passionate about groundbreaking technology and helping your customers and peers succeed? Would you like the opportunity to work at a fast-growing company that is changing the way that information is used to support business
content:
Krak√≥w, Krak√≥w, Poland

Are you passionate about groundbreaking technology and helping your customers and peers succeed? Would you like the opportunity to work at a fast-growing company that is changing the way that information is used to support business decisions? If you answered yes to these questions, then we have a home for you at Splunk!

Do you enjoy working collaboratively within a team to solve hard problems? Are you passionate about making customers successful? Like rolling up your sleeves and working with data to find patterns and hidden meanings? How about using your development skills to design solutions to make data more valuable and usable to your customers? If you answered yes to these questions, then the Splunk Forward Deployed Software Engineer (FDSE) might be the role for you!

As a developer within Field Solutions, you will be responsible for building rapid solutions for the quick customer win. You will help define the customer strategy in developing areas and be supportive of that strategy. At times, you must be able to engage at a technical level to assist with architecture and design development initiatives. The ideal candidate will be self-motivated and have provided software development, technology consulting, systems administration, or technical solutions. You should be comfortable discussing issues of scale and fostering innovation in a dynamic technical organization with a rapidly expanding customer base. You should be able to research, build, and deliver Splunk integrations to our customers.

  • Familiarity with backend technologies such as Python, Flask, Django as well as frontend technologies such as JavaScript, HTML, CSS, or React
  • Written and verbal communications skills
  • Usable knowledge of security, networking, server, database, and enterprise applications
  • Familiarity with products, companies, and solutions in the DevOps, IT & Security marketplaces
  • Self-motivated, self-learner and willing to collaborate with customers and fellow Splunkers
  • Ability to work with diverse teams spread across the globe

content:
Oxford (Hybrid), United Kingdom

My clients are looking for an ambitious mid-level Python Software Engineer, who is looking to grow their career and skillset with one of the UK‚Äôs most exciting Healthtech scaleups.

You will

  • Design and build their Research System - an innovative collection of Python tooling that underpins cutting-edge computer vision and deep learning research
  • Create high-quality Python software libraries which bind together their research environment, including technologies such as MariaDB, Docker, Nomad, Gitlab CI & MlFlow

Requirements

The ideal candidate will have a passion for technology and writing high quality, scalable code. They should be able to commute to the Oxford office at least 1 day per week. The successful candidate is likely to:

  • Be comfortable in a fast-moving environment where priorities may change quickly
  • Want to learn, be curious and dig into areas that need fixing, improving and automating

  • Understand the importance of testing and test automation
  • Be pragmatic, self-motivated and goal oriented

Experience

  • Python 2+ years
  • Experience contributing to a shared codebase, writing modular code
  • Version Control System (e.g. Git)
  • Linux

Desirable but not essential

  • SQL
  • PySpark
  • CI / CD (e.g. Jenkins, Gitlab runners)
  • Aspire to TDD, but not in an idealistic way that slows development

summary: Brno or Brumov-Bylnice, Czech Republic About Wattstor: Wattstor is a fast-growing start-up in the renewable energy sector and is dedicated to clean energy use. We make complicated innovative technology simple, easy to install, enjoyable, clean and
content:
Brno or Brumov-Bylnice, Czech Republic

About Wattstor:

Wattstor is a fast-growing start-up in the renewable energy sector and is dedicated to clean energy use. We make complicated innovative technology simple, easy to install, enjoyable, clean and aesthetically appealing. Our own intelligent management unit has been designed to manage energy and especially renewable energy in several behind-the-meter applications. With years dedicated to research and development, Wattstor's smart and sustainable solutions have proven their value in practice and can be deployed in the field quickly and at low cost.

Role: Wattstor is looking for talented Python developer for edge control devices. You will be developing and optimising control logic for energy flows and communication with external devices via ethernet (like EV chargers, Batteries, Photovoltaic or Heat pump). Development is based on Ubuntu linux and Python 3.x

You will be part of a team developing real time management and monitoring, code running on edge controller devices.

We have a test lab for integration testing and also cooperate with FEKT VUT Brno

Required

  • Fluency in Python 3, Linux experience
  • Docker and application containerization experience
  • Git (including pull requests and code reviews, branching strategy)

Advantage

  • Experience in energy industry
  • Hands-on experience developing device communication for Ethernet interfaces.
  • Familiar with SiL and HiL testing
  • Experience with cloud computing and REST APIs
  • Experience with protocol Modbus TCP
  • Familiar with ARM-based SBCs.

summary: Heidelberg, Germany Our team of software developers and physicist creates software enabling scientists to perform unique experiments using our electron optical components. Large parts of the software are written in Python providing the following
content:
Heidelberg, Germany

Our team of software developers and physicist creates software enabling scientists to perform unique experiments using our electron optical components. Large parts of the software are written in Python providing the following functionalities:

  • controlling the hardware of our components
  • communication with different microscopes and image/data acquisition devices
  • provide scripting interfaces
  • data processing and analysis

We are looking for a curious computer specialist willing to support our experts for electron microscopes in all computer related tasks:

  • Locate the root-cause of strange and unexpected behaviour of the software.
  • Ensure smooth communication between the components and solve installation issues.
  • Implement new functionalities and verify them at the microscope.

A profound knowledge of Python is important as most code is written in Python. Experience in fixing typical day-to-day Linux and Windows issues is also helpful.

Knowledge in concurrent programming using asyncio or multithreading/-processing is a benefit.

content:
Minneapolis, Minnesota, United States

The Sr. Software Engineer (FULLY REMOTE) is a key member of our Engineering team. In this role, you will be responsible for managing and supporting full-stack design, development, enhancement and support of new and existing modules for integrations and analytics components of our SaaS-based farm management platform. Our solutions encompass a broad range of mobile, web and loT technologies, bringing together operational data, financials and machine data to enable control, visibility and actionable insight into large-scale agriculture operations.

This role requires the ability to conduct highly complex work with limited supervision and an extensive latitude for independent judgment. In addition, the Sr. Software Engineer may need to assist in mentoring less-experience software engineers. The ideal candidate will have experience building and scaling high-volume, multi-tenant SaaS platforms and have a passion for innovation and making an impact in industry that is responsible for feeding the world.

title: Community Events Manager, Python Software Foundation
summary: Remote, United States The Python Software Foundation (PSF) is a 501(c)(3) non-profit corporation that holds the intellectual property rights behind the Python programming language. We also run the PyCon US Conference annually, support other Python
content:
Remote, United States

The Python Software Foundation (PSF) is a 501(c)(3) non-profit corporation that holds the intellectual property rights behind the Python programming language. We also run the PyCon US Conference annually, support other Python conferences/workshops around the world, and fund Python related development with our grants program. The mission of the Python Software Foundation is to promote, protect, and advance the Python programming language, and to support and facilitate the growth of a diverse and international community of Python programmers.

We are currently a small organization and we are looking for great employees who can grow with us. While the PSF has busy parts of the year, we offer PTO, summer Fridays, and holidays. Rest and renewal makes us all our best selves both at home and at work.

The PSF seeks a full-time employee to work on PyCon US, the largest annual gathering of the Python community. This position will also support smaller community events and meetings throughout the year. This year‚Äôs event will be a masked event and require COVID-19 vaccine verification for attendees.

Responsibilities

  • Co-lead planning and support for our annual flagship professional event, PyCon US
  • Manage onsite logistics, including communication with onsite vendors and expo floor design
  • Manage vendor relationships, including soliciting quotes, negotiating prices and services and communicating about ongoing needs
  • Work with AV team, food and beverage staff, and hotel contacts to ensure a great conference experience
  • Manage all attendee registration and signage
  • Communicate with various stakeholders; attendees, speakers, and volunteers
  • Support sponsor needs and benefit fulfillment both onsite and in advance
  • Year-round administrative support for smaller internal meetings and developer sprints plus managing our sponsorship of other community events
  • Work onsite once a year ~2 weeks on location plus possible location scouting or vendor visits 4-6 times per year

Requirements

  • Strong project management ability
  • Ability to delegate properly and be able to prioritize responsibilities
  • Excellent written and verbal communications skills
  • Attention to detail is a must
  • Experience with event registration systems
  • Strong computer proficiency skills and ability to learn new programs
  • Comfortable collaborating as part of a remote team (Slack, Google docs/sheets)
  • Ability to work independently while being able to be a good team member
  • Ability to maintain a professional manner and ask for help when things are busy
  • Comfortable working on an event-planning deadline
  • Comfortable interacting with diverse contributors in many different countries, with widely varying backgrounds

Preferred experience

  • 3 to 4 years of experience with managing professional events of comparable scale/structure.
  • Experience with vendor management and conference organizing strongly preferred
  • Experience managing volunteers
  • Experience with project management tools, like Asana and Trello
  • Familiarity with the global open source community
  • Excellent customer service and communication skills
  • Excellent organizational skills

Details We are seeking a full-time employee who will focus on supporting our annual flagship event and the year-round community of volunteers, vendors, and other stakeholders that make up the Python community. The ability and willingness to travel annually to PyCon US is required for this position. The PSF is a fully remote and distributed team and welcomes applications from any location in the US (we cannot sponsor visas or accept applications from outside the US for this role). This position will report to the Program Director.

title: Site Reliability Engineer (f/m/d) - Defense Products, United Internet
summary: Berlin, Germany Our team of highly motivated experts against cyber security attacks are looking for more teammates. As a site reliability engineer you will develop and operate together with system administrators and network engineers our defense platforms
content:
Berlin, Germany

Our team of highly motivated experts against cyber security attacks are looking for more teammates. As a site reliability engineer you will develop and operate together with system administrators and network engineers our defense platforms which protect our hosting products and infrastructure. Besides the classical DDoS Mitigation, we are also responsible for modern web application firewall or zero trust strategies. In a culture which places great value on creative ideas, agile working methods, initiative, and participation you can expect the following tasks:

  • Development and adjustment of our defense logic to mitigate DDoS attacks on the network and application layer.
  • Optimizing current pipelines for automatic threat detection and mitigation and the reporting of those.
  • Support our system administrators to automate operational tasks and rollouts.
  • Provide interfaces for integration in our hosting products for other teams.
  • Administration and troubleshooting of our high-available and complex infrastructure including participation in an on-call service rotation.
  • Support company goals through efficient operating architecture, active lifecycle management and lean processes in an agile DevOps environment.

You have studied computer science or have completed comparable education. You have a keen interest in security topics, good network knowledge, and have the following qualifications:

  • Several years of experience in system near development of highly available software artifacts, written in programming or scripting languages: Go, C, Python, PHP, Bash.
  • Experience in writing application logic with Lua as a scripting language in combination with nginx would be ideal.
  • Practical experience of operating nginx as reverse proxy or web application firewall.
  • Infrastructure as code and automation are important parts of your own way of working.
  • Additional experience about BGP, flowspec, anycast routing as well as the basic understanding of network protocols on linux systems are not foreign to you.
  • Good analytical skills to evaluate DDoS attacks, implement countermeasures, and continuously develop our defense platforms.
  • Like us, you are a fan of Open Source, especially Linux.
  • The ability to communicate with an international team fluently in English, German is a benefit.

title: MIDDLE/SENIOR PYTHON DEVELOPER (BEESWAX/USERDATA TEAM), SigmaSoftware

content:
Bras√≠lia, Brazil

We are fundamentally looking for people who enjoy working in a team that gets drive by an ever-changing startup environment and an atmosphere of adventures. As our future Python Developer, you are expected to demonstrate a strong level of responsibility and flexibility, the ‚Äúget-it-done-attitude‚Äù. We would love our prospect candidate to complement the Beeswax engineering team and drive further development of the platform.

Are you in?

CUSTOMER

Our customer is a rapidly growing US AdTech company Beeswax. Founded by three ex-Googlers, it has a highly technical team and an excellent technological culture. Beeswax provides extremely high-scale Bidder-as-a-Service solutions in advertising technology, works with global businesses, and has to date raised $28M (including the most recent Series B raise of $15M). Sigma Software works together with Beeswax to enable the delivery of numerous key components of the platform. It is looking for engineers to complement Beeswax engineering team and drive further development of the platform.

PROJECT

We are working on a project providing a REST API to customers and a JavaScript UI. So, your job will be focused on creating a maintainable API around a very complex data model and around creating a highly usable UI/UX.

This role will require demonstrating a strong level of responsibility and flexibility and the ‚Äúget-it-done-attitude‚Äù. If you enjoy working in a team that drives new business value creation, then this job is for you!

  • Upper-Intermediate level of spoken and written English
  • Must be versatile and an inquisitive problem solver
  • Good knowledge of AWS services
  • Hands-on experience with SQL and NoSQL databases

WOULD BE A PLUS:

  • Working experience with Terraform
  • Working experience with Kubernetes

title: Python Data Engineer, Homesourcing
summary: Remote, Remote, Remote About you: We are looking for you, to join our team and client in a new role of Python Data Engineer, if you are excellent at transforming raw data into useful data systems. You will be an enabler of our AI-powered SAAS software -
content:
Remote, Remote, Remote

About you:

We are looking for you, to join our team and client in a new role of Python Data Engineer, if you are excellent at transforming raw data into useful data systems. You will be an enabler of our AI-powered SAAS software - and an important contributor to our success.

You have long experience working with complex data, combining multiple data sources, and utilizing machine learning.

Ideally, you are a freelancer and open to full-time, dedicated work, looking also for a long-term commitment, based anywhere in Europe.

Main responsibilities for this position:

  • Analyze and organize raw data
  • Build, monitor, and optimize processing pipelines
  • Build and improve data systems
  • Develop analytical tools and programs
  • Evaluate business needs and objectives
  • Conduct complex data analysis and report on results
  • Prepare data for prescriptive and predictive modeling
  • Build algorithms and prototypes
  • Explore ways to enhance data quality and reliability
  • Collaborate with data scientists and architects on projects
  • Ensure compliance with data governance, and security policies
  • The position reports to the CTO

Requirements:

  • Higher education with a minimum of a bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science or similar
  • 4-6 years experience in data engineering
  • Technical expertise in data models, data mining, and segmentation techniques
  • Numerical and analytical skills
  • Familiarity with ETL tools like Airflow or Luigi
  • Long experience in operations
  • Hands-on experience with Python and Spark
  • Solid knowledge of programming languages (Python)
  • 5+ years of experience working with databases, data modeling, and SQL
  • Experience setting up and maintaining complex pipelines
  • Excellent verbal and written communication in English (B2+)

Bonus points for:

  • Relevant Data Engineering Certifications
  • Experience with container-based workflows
  • Experience with Data Warehouses

content:
Remote, United States

About the Role:

We are looking for a knowledgeable, experienced all around Python Django DRF superstar to help build out and maintain API for our suite of web apps. We have a robust set of dealer and consumer facing automotive applications, and while our core PHP API is mature, we are always adding new features and functionality. The ideal candidate would have deep experience in both Django and MySQL, and have experience working with front-end developers to produce API output that works well with modern Angular frontends.

We use modern tools to improve our productivity and are always looking to include innovative new approaches to our process. We run on Angular/Django/DRF and AWS. We've been remote since our inception and have a great culture built around online communication and collaboration.

We are looking for someone with experience including:

  • 5+ Django framework / DRF, ideally with REST framework development
  • 5+ MySQL and PostgresSQL
  • Comfort building new application features as well as maintaining and refactoring existing code
  • Sr. level MySQL and PostgresSQL experience, with skills around SQL optimization
  • Experience working in a CI/CD environment
  • Experience working in a fully remote environment with an agile team
  • Ability to work with QA to quickly identify and resolve tough to troubleshoot issues
  • Experience with swagger or other documentation tools
  • Ability to write clearly and concisely and document processes and code
  • Automated test experience

Bonus: * Automotive industry experience is a nice plus!

Note: This is a full time W2 position. US eligible workers only.

title: Data Engineer (f/m/d), United Internet
summary: Karlsruhe, Germany Do you love to identify the needs of your customers and develop the appropriate solutions? Then you've come to the right place! Our mission is to help small and micro businesses build and grow their professional online presence. In our
content:
Karlsruhe, Germany

Do you love to identify the needs of your customers and develop the appropriate solutions? Then you've come to the right place! Our mission is to help small and micro businesses build and grow their professional online presence. In our product areas "Sitebuilder, Marketing & eCommerce" (SME) and "Email & Office", you will be largely responsible for the data-driven (further) development of our product ideas and the operation of the applications.

You are part of a cross-functional product team and enable data-based decisions for targeted development with your usage and product analyses along the entire customer journey, as well as test and monitoring results.

Together with the product owner and UX designer, you create user stories, requirements and concepts to design an optimal customer journey (events, triggers, next best activities, presentation of product KPIs to end users). From the resulting functional and non-functional requirements, you will create a concept for the continuous monitoring of the quality of the provided services based on technical indicators, in close cooperation with software development and test management.

You will work with internal and external project partners to develop all the necessary data sources. In doing so, you will act as an interface to sources of knowledge from other stakeholders (data scientists, market research, etc.) and ensure that quantitative and qualitative insights are interlinked.

  • Conception and implementation of usage and product analyses, dashboards and reports.
  • Provide technical advice to both the development and operations teams, as well as the product management teams.
  • You are well connected in the overall context of product development.
  • You have a strong orientation towards implementation.
  • You have several years of experience in the design and implementation of distributed data processing systems or as a big data analyst.
  • You have profound knowledge in the development of applications with Spring Boot, Python, SQL, Hadoop & Spark as well as in the use of tools such as Prometheus, Kibana and GIT in a K8s environment.
  • You have extensive experience with the analysis of data structures and the development of the necessary algorithms. Ideally, you have already dealt with ideas from the field of AI in this regard.
  • You feel at home both in technology (advising DevOps teams) and in business (advising product management).
  • You stand out due to your excellent communication skills and can implement and document the requirements you create yourself.
  • Fluency in English rounds off your profile.

content:

  • Planning, design, installation and development of the Linux server landscape based on Ubuntu as well as a high-performance cloud platform based on OpenStack.
  • Administration and maintenance of a highly available Linux cloud as well as performance, capacity and availability management of the Linux servers.
  • Ensuring the operational business, using a trouble ticket system (trouble shooting, second/third level support). Automation and continuous optimization of all technical process flows.
  • Customization and creation of automation processes and automatic system configurations (scripting) as well as IT Security support to implement hardening/securing of server systems and the services running on them.

title: 2 Python Developers, 3E
summary: Brussels or Fully Remote within Europe, Europe, Belgium 3E‚Äôs innovation department "iLab" works on the productization of R&D results in the domains of solar and wind energy. Our different products and services include, among others: satellite-derived solar
content:
Brussels or Fully Remote within Europe, Europe, Belgium

3E‚Äôs innovation department "iLab" works on the productization of R&D results in the domains of solar and wind energy. Our different products and services include, among others: satellite-derived solar irradiation data, wind resource data & modelling, solar and wind forecasting services, and artificial intelligence for the automatic fault detection on solar PV parks and wind farms.

Our daily operations involve scientific computing, big data processing & storage, deployment and maintenance of products and services.

You join a team of engineers, scientists, DevOps and product managers that develop, operate, and commercialize innovative solutions in the renewable energy domain worldwide.

We are looking for a talented Python developer to support us on the development, testing, documentation, and operation of services dealing with high volumes of data while keeping an efficient use of our infrastructure.

Your day-to-day tasks will include:

  • Developing reliable and scalable applications, by writing clean and tested code
  • Working with domain experts to productize new research results or maintain existing applications
  • Operating applications throughout their life cycle on Kubernetes with our automated CI/CD pipeline
  • Monitoring and troubleshoot operational or data issues

You are an open minded and proactive team player with good communication skills who enjoys challenges and growing an innovative product to the next level.

What we are looking for in our new Python developer:

  • A Degree in computer science, engineering, data science, or related
  • Minimum 5 years of first relevant professional experience as a developer
  • Demonstrated ability to operate effectively in a multi-tasking environment
  • Strong analytical skills
  • Team player with good communication skills
  • Fluent in English

You must have strong experience with the following technical stack:

  • Python
  • Code testing, OOP and best practices
  • Docker and Kubernetes
  • SQL databases and related python libraries (sqlalchemy, alembic, etc.)
  • Developing REST APIs (Flask is a plus)
  • Multithreading and parallel processing

Bonus points for:

  • Experience with AWS or other cloud technologies
  • Experience in one or more data engineering and data science tools (pandas, numpy, etc.)
  • Familiar with multidimensional data structure and formats (netCDF, Zarr, etc.)
